articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Sends Messages to Foreign Heads of State
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Sends Messages to Foreign Heads of State
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent messages to heads of state of different countries in reply to their messages expressing profound condolences over the passing of general secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 They included the king of Malaysia, the president of Myanmar, the sultan and the head of state of Brunei Darussalam, the presidents of Singapore, the Philippines, Turkey, Azerbaijan, Uzbekistan and Iran, the prime minister of India, the president of Greece, the former president of Switzerland, the presidents of Mozambique, Cameroon and Peru and the governor-general of Australia.
					
					 Kim in their messages expressed deep thanks to them for sending messages of condolences over the passing of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and those countries would continue to grow stronger in various fields.

articles.title: Greetings to Sri Lanka President
articles.content:
Greetings to Sri Lanka President
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of greeting to Sri Lanka President Mahinda Rajapaksa on the 64th anniversary of its independence.
					 Kim in the message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in various fields and sincerely wished the president success in his work for achieving the political stability of the country and national unity.

articles.title: Greetings to Sri Lankan PM
articles.content:
Greetings to Sri Lankan PM
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim sent on Wednesday a message of greeting to Prime Minister of Sri Lanka D.M.Jayaratne on its 64th independence day.
					 The message wished him greater success in his work for economic development of the country and people's well-being.
					
					 DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a similar message to his Sri Lankan counterpart G.L.Peris.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Learns about Work at Biology Branch under State Academy of  Sciences
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Learns about Work at Biology Branch under State Academy of Sciences 
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim acquainted himself with the work at the Biology Branch under the State Academy of Sciences on the spot on Friday.
					 The branch is rigged with sophisticated scientific research apparatuses and a modern greenhouse for scientific researches and cultivation of fruit tree saplings was also built under the meticulous guidance and warm benevolence of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The scientists and researchers at the branch opened a definite prospect for massively cultivating short apple saplings by use of the technology of tissue culture true to the instruction of Kim Jong Il, bringing about innovations in the scientific researches to push back the frontiers of the latest science and technology.
					
					 Choe looked round other places alive with scientific researches in response to the decision of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, the joint calls of the Central Committee and the Central Military Commission of the Party and the joint New Year editorial. 
					
					 Then he called a consultative meeting of officials concerned.
					
					 The meeting discussed specific issues arising in remarkably developing biological engineering, a core basic technology of the scientific and technological development in the present era, bearing in mind the great loving care and trust of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It also took measures to ensure that the relevant units supply a sufficient quantity of raw and other materials necessary for scientific researches.

articles.title: Egyptian Businessman Leaves for Home
articles.content:
Egyptian Businessman Leaves for Home
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Naguib Sawiris, executive chairman of the Orascom Telecom Media and Technology Holdings SAE of Egypt, and his companion flew back Friday.

articles.title: Egyptian Businessman Lauds Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Egyptian Businessman Lauds Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Naguib Sawiris, executive chairman of the Orascom Telecom Media and Technology Holdings SAE of Egypt, was interviewed by KCNA before his departure from here. 
					 Expressing profound reverence for general secretary Kim Jong Il, he said:
					
					 The Korean people lost a great leader. I also lost the most friendly man. General Kim Jong Il was a great father of the people.
					
					 I can never forget the day when I had the honor of being received by him.
					
					 While meeting him, I was totally attracted by his humanity.
					
					 He was the greatest man possessed of the noblest virtue.
					
					 His untimely passing was a great loss not only to the Korean people but to progressive humankind.
					
					 He devoted his all to his people with ardent love for the people.
					
					 While staying in the DPRK I was deeply moved to visit the Pyongyang Children's Foodstuff Factory honored with the leadership provided by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He paid deep attention to the operation of the factory.
					
					 The tireless efforts made by him for the happiness of the people will be conveyed to posterity for all ages.
					
					 The Korean people are energetically pushing forward socialist construction under the sagacious leadership of supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 I sincerely rejoice over the achievements made by the Korean people. 
					
					 I wish the Korean people greater progress.
					
					 I would like to make a positive contribution to boosting the exchange with the DPRK.

articles.title: Gift from Egyptian Businessman
articles.content:
Gift from Egyptian Businessman
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people, received a gift from the executive chairman of the Orascom Telecom Media and Technology Holdings SAE of Egypt.
					 Chairman Naguib Sawiris handed it to an official concerned on Thursday.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Grim Resolve to Win National Liberation
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Grim Resolve to Win National Liberation
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- 87 years has passed since President Kim Il Sung crossed the River Amnok with a grim resolve to liberate Korea from the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule. 
					 The President departed his birthplace, Mangyongdae in Pyongyang on January 22, Juche 14 (1925) and reached the Phophyong ferry in the northern tip of Korea after more than ten days.
					
					 In his reminiscences "With the Century", the President said:
					
					 "I had spent only two years back in my motherland, but I had learned and experienced much in those years. My most valuable experience was to have acquired a deep understanding of our people. Our people were simple, and industrious yet brave and strong-willed. They were staunch people who did not yield, whatever the adversity or hardship; they were polite and kindhearted and yet resolute and uncompromising against injustice. From that time I believed that I could liberate the country if I organized their efforts properly."
					
					 He walked slowly towards the opposite side of the river singing quietly the Song of the River Amnok.
					
					 He looked back at the mountains in the motherland over and again with sorrow and indignation. He made a grim resolve not to return before Korea had become independent.
					
					 True to that day's resolve, the President led the 20-year-long anti-Japanese war to a victory to accomplish the historic cause of national liberation.

articles.title: Koreans in Japan Demand Halt to Projected War Exercises
articles.content:
Koreans in Japan Demand Halt to Projected War Exercises
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Ri Tong Je, chairman of the Association of Koreans in Japan for Peaceful Reunification in a statement on Wednesday accused the United States and the south Korean authorities of their planned joint military exercises.
					 Under the title of "We can never allow the joint military exercises for aggression", the statement noted that the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet warmongers are scheming to stage Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises, dangerous war games aimed at invasion of the DPRK, on the Korean Peninsula this year, too, despite the strong protest at home and abroad.
					
					 This is an intolerable mockery and challenge not only to all Koreans in the north and the south and abroad desirous for peace and security of the country but also to conscience of the international community, it said, adding:
					
					 As they had asserted whenever staging military exercises, the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean authorities impudently advertised the planned rehearsals as "annual ones for defence".
					
					 However, those exercises have already and long been known as a rehearsal for attack on the DPRK under the U.S. operation plan.
					
					 If the south Korean authorities truly want the improved relations with the DPRK and peace on the Korean Peninsula, they should cancel at once the planned military drills for aggression quite contrary to such practice and make apology before anything else for the high treason they committed against the fellow countrymen who suffered a great loss.
					
					 The U.S. should stop such deceptive moves as calling for dialogue with the DPRK and denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula while instigating the south Korean puppet authorities to dangerous military actions aimed at disturbing peace and denuclearization, and pull its troops out of south Korea.
					
					 The Association of Koreans in Japan for Peaceful Reunification will put spurs to the nation's movement for independence and unity and peace against war to foil the separatist forces' moves and open up a turning phase for independent reunification.

articles.title: S. Korean Workers Declare General Strike
articles.content:
S. Korean Workers Declare General Strike
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions held a meeting in Seoul on Jan. 31 at which it declared a general strike to oust the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors pursuing an unpopular rule.
					 The speakers said that this year is a landmark year for putting an end to the authorities' traitorous rule for the rich who account for  just one percent of the population, calling for bringing down the fascist dictatorship through the workers' struggle.
					
					 They underscored the need to bring earlier a society where the basic right to labor and political freedom are guaranteed to the workers.
					
					 They declared they would get all the evil laws on labor of the authorities repealed through a dynamic struggle and foil their moves to stamp out the democratic trade unions, no matter what trial they may face. They called upon the workers across south Korea and progressive forces to unite and solidarize with one another to win the general election slated to take place in April.

articles.title: Authorities' Anti-Peace Action Flailed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Authorities' Anti-Peace Action Flailed in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Civic and social organizations in south Korea held the 119th rally for peace and disarmament in Seoul on Jan. 31.
					 Speakers at the rally noted that the authorities are seeking to purchase F-35 fighters from the United States.
					
					 Such purchase of weapons will batten the U.S. munitions businesses with taxes collected from people and further aggravate the situation of the Korean Peninsula and its surrounding areas, they charged.
					
					 They also said that the authorities have planned to stage Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises with the U.S., escalating the military tension from the outset of the year.
					
					 The projected exercises are evidently a war rehearsal for aggression supposing "contingency" in the DPRK, they said.

articles.title: Biting Cold, Heavy Snow Hit Several Countries
articles.content:
Biting Cold, Heavy Snow Hit Several Countries 
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Inclement weather and heavy snow hit several countries.
					 Relatively moderate temperature was registered in Europe till late January but cold front moved from the northeastern area after January 27, causing drastic temperature drop.
					
					 The eastern and central Europe suffered most and the southern and the western areas were also swept by biting cold, resulting in increased death toll and traffic disruptions.
					
					 In Ukraine over 60 died of cold and more than 1,140 had frostbitten as of Feb. 2. The country recorded minus 33 degrees Celsius, the lowest in 6 years.
					
					 The freezing cold that hit Romania and Poland also claimed 22 and 29 lives each.
					
					Death toll was reported and more than 11,000 citizens were cut off from the outer world in Serbia. 12 cities were put on an alert.
					
					 The temperature in the eastern areas of Bosnia-Herzegovina went down to minus 31 degrees Celsius while in Bulgaria minus 30 degrees.
					
					 Heavy snow blocked off roads in the vast northern and central areas of Italy and electricity supply was cut off for 50 000 citizens of Corsica of France.
					
					 Biting cold and heavy snow also affected Asia.
					
					 Minus 40 degrees Celsius cold persisted for more than 10 days in the most north China. Temperature dipped to an all-time record low of minus 46.9 degrees Celsius in the Inner Mongolian Autonomous Region in 46 years.
					
					 Minus 40 degrees Celsius biting cold that hit Kazakhstan caused school shut-downs in Astana City, North Kazakhstan, East Kazakhstan and Akmola Region. 
					
					 Azerbaijan registered rare night record of minus 20 degree Celsius in some areas. 
					
					 In Japan heavy snowfall killed 56 people as of February 2. More than 4 meters of snow accumulated in Aomori City while some areas in Yamagata and Niigata prefectures had snow over 3 meters deep, the Japan Meteorological Agency said.
					
					 Over 50 cm of snowfall was recorded also in Istanbul of Turkey, where it is usually rare to see snow.
					
					 According to weather experts, such phenomenon is due to high temperatures around the North Pole.
					
					 They said that the current damage by cold weather is the worst in decades.

articles.title: Russia Urges U.S. and South Korea to Exercise Self-restraint
articles.content:
Russia Urges U.S. and South Korea to Exercise Self-restraint
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Valery E.Sukhinin, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, at a press conference urged the United States and south Korea to consider the DPRK's concern over their projected joint military exercises on the Korean Peninsula. 
					 This is certainly necessary for ensuring stability on the peninsula, he said, and went on: 
					
					 Russia calls on the U.S. and south Korea to exercise self-restraint in consideration of the Koreans' sad feelings over the passing of Kim Jong Il, chairman of the National Defence Commission. 
					
					 The leadership of the DPRK declared more than once that it is its ultimate goal to denuclearize the peninsula by implementing the behest of President Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 The DPRK, however, holds that an agreement should be mutually beneficial and it should not disturb the security of Korea but help strengthen it.

articles.title: Russia Beefs up Its Ground Force
articles.content:
Russia Beefs up Its Ground Force
 Moscow, February 2 (KCNA) -- Russia is channeling its efforts into beefing up its ground force.
					 Last year Russia procured more than 30 jet-type multiple launch system "Tornado-Grad" for missile and artillery units of the ground force.
					
					 This launching system, a largely improved version of multiple launch rocket system "Grad," is capable of rapidly striking targets in the long distance with high precision. 
					
					 This system is reportedly equipped with various automated devices and its combat efficiency is 2.5 or 3 times higher than "Grad" multiple launch rocket system. 
					
					 A spokesperson for the Russian ground force clarified this on Jan. 31.

articles.title: Iranian FM Refers to Role of Media
articles.content:
Iranian FM Refers to Role of Media
 Tehran, February 2 (KCNA) -- Iranian Foreign Minister Ali Akbar Salehi said on Tuesday that the role and power of media is the same as military power in a way that it can determine losers or winners in global challenges. 
					 Salehi made the remark in the special ceremony marking the launch of new Spanish TV network.
					
					 The only way to confront the arrogant media is to launch new media tasked with promoting ethics and sincerity and adopting unbiased policies and approaches, he said.

articles.title: Larijani: Iran Not to Remain Silent on U.S. Meddling in Regional Developments
articles.content:
Larijani: Iran Not to Remain Silent on U.S. Meddling in Regional Developments 
 Tehran, February 2 (KCNA) -- Iran's Majlis Speaker Ali Larijani said on Monday that if the U.S. seeks to meddle in regional developments and create problems, the Islamic Republic of Iran will not remain indifference and will take proper action. 
					 He made the remark in a meeting with his Indonesian counterpart Marzuki Alie on the sidelines of the 7th General Assembly Meeting of Islamic Inter-Parliamentary Union on Monday. 
					
					 Strait of Hormuz is well known for its tranquility and Iran for centuries has maintained peace and security of the region, Larijani noted. 
					
					 The U.S. is not satisfied with regional developments and believes that waves of revolutions in Islamic states will put its interests at risk and for this reason it is trying to meddle in regional developments, Larijani said.

articles.title: India Rejects U.S., West's Sanctions against Iran
articles.content:
India Rejects U.S., West's Sanctions against Iran
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- The Indian minister of Finance in a speech during his visit to the U.S. on Jan. 29 expressed the stand of his country rejecting the U.S. and West's sanctions against Iran.
					 It is unimaginable for India to decide to drastically decrease the oil import from Iran, he said.
					
					 India will not join the U.S. and West in applying the sanctions against Iran, he stressed.

articles.title: India's Economic Growth
articles.content:
India's Economic Growth 
 New Delhi, February 2 (KCNA) -- "The Gross Domestic Product (GDP) at factor cost at constant prices in 2010-11 has registered a growth of 8.4 percent over the previous year," said provisional data released by the Indian Ministry of Statistics and Program Implementation on Jan. 31.
					 Many successes have been made in the sectors of agriculture, manufacturing, construction and services in particular during the period.

articles.title: Iran Announces Its Plan to Produce Nuclear Fuel Itself
articles.content:
Iran Announces Its Plan to Produce Nuclear Fuel Itself
 Teheran, February 2 (KCNA) -- Iranian Foreign Minister Ali Akbar Salehi on Jan. 30 announced the government's plan to produce by itself nuclear fuel necessary for  nuclear reactor for research from several months later.
					An adoption of an unreasonable UNSC resolution on tightening the sanctions against Iran prevented uranium exchange, he said, adding that his country decided to conduct uranium enrichment up to 20 percent by itself.
					
					 Refuting the U.S. and other Western countries' accusations over Iran's development of nuclear weapons, he declared Iran's nuclear activities are for meeting the country's demand for electricity.

articles.title: Iran Warns West of Tighter Sanctions
articles.content:
Iran Warns West of Tighter Sanctions
 Teheran, February 2 (KCNA) -- The vice-minister of Oil accused the West of its tighter sanctions against his country on Jan. 29.
					 Clarifying the government's stand to stop oil export to Western countries in protest against their sanctions, he noted if this measure takes effect, the West's oil processing factories would suffer tremendous loss.
					
					 It will be the West that will lose a lot owing to unreasonable sanctions against Iran, he warned.

articles.title: U.S. Consumer Confidence Retreats in January
articles.content:
U.S. Consumer Confidence Retreats in January
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- U.S. consumer confidence fell in Jan. 2012, a report said on Tuesday.
					 The Conference Board, which conducted monthly consumer confidence survey, said that its consumer confidence index fell to 61.1 from 64.8 in Dec. 2011.

articles.title: Homicide Cases Recorded in New York
articles.content:
Homicide Cases Recorded in New York
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Homicide cases were rampant in New York, creating big social uneasiness and fear.
					 New York state witnessed roughly 750 homicide cases in 2011, New York officials said on Monday.

articles.title: Eurozone Unemployment Rate Hits Record High at 10.4 pct
articles.content:
Eurozone Unemployment Rate Hits Record High at 10.4 pct
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- The European Union's (EU) statistical bureau Eurostat said on Tuesday that 23.816 million men and women in the EU, of whom 16.469 million were in the eurozone, were unemployed in December last year. Compared with November, the number of persons unemployed increased by 24 thousand in the EU and by 20 thousand in the eurozone.

articles.title: Japan's Industrial Output Falls 3.5% in 2011
articles.content:
Japan's Industrial Output Falls 3.5% in 2011
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Japan's industrial production index fell 3.5 percent in 2011 from the previous year, the Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry said in a preliminary report on Jan. 31.

articles.title: Net Profits Decrease in Electric Appliances Producers of Japan
articles.content:
Net Profits Decrease in Electric Appliances Producers of Japan
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Fujitsu Ltd. said Tuesday its group net profit for the April-December period in 2011 plunged 96.0 percent from a year earlier.
					 Toshiba Corp. on Tuesday said its group net profit plunged 70.0 percent from a year earlier.

articles.title: Total Halt to Construction of Jeju Naval Base Called for
articles.content:
Total Halt to Construction of Jeju Naval Base Called for
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Measure Council for Checking the Construction of Jeju Naval Base held a press conference on Jan. 31 demanding a total halt to the construction of the Juju naval base.
					 The organization recalled in a press release that the naval base construction is steadily pushed forward at Kangjong village, Jeju Island, amid police cordon, posing a threat to the living of the inhabitants. 
					
					 The construction project is an illegal one unilaterally started by the military authorities in utter defiance of the will of the inhabitants of the area, the press release noted, and continued:
					
					 The prosecution and the police arrested inhabitants, religionists and participants in the peace movement and are treating them as criminals, and the Agency for Cultural Properties and the Jeju Island side approved the construction project despite the fact that cultural relics were discovered around the construction site, and are backing the military authorities in pushing forward the project. 
					
					 The inhabitants in Kangjong village and the Jeju islanders who love peace and justice will strongly demand an immediate halt to the construction of the naval base and stage actions for solidarity with the people from all walks of life, it stressed.

articles.title: General Secretary Lauded Abroad
articles.content:
General Secretary Lauded Abroad
Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Cuautemoc Amezcua Dromundo, chairman of the C.C., Socialist Popular Party of Mexico, and Humberto Vargas Carbonel, general secretary of the C.C., People's Vanguard of Costa Rica, issued statements to commemorate the birth anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Cuautemoc Amezcua Dromundo in his statement on January 27 praised Kim Jong Il as the peerless patriot, sun of the nation, unparalleled illustrious commander of Songun and benevolent father of the people.
					
					 The party, army and people of the DPRK will hold the dear respected           Kim Jong Un in high esteem as the centre of unity and cohesion of the party and its leadership and defend him politically and ideologically and at the risk of their lives, he said.
					
					 The chairman expressed belief that the revolutionary cause of Juche, the cause of Songun revolution guided by Kim Jong Il all his life would surely emerge victorious and his behests would be brilliantly realized.
					
					 Humberto Vargas Carbonel in a statement on January 25 noted that the world progressives are conducting brisk activities to significantly commemorate the 70th birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il as a common holiday of humankind.
					
					 Kim Jong Il's whole life was the most brilliant one of a legendary hero who provided the solid foundations for eternal prosperity of the country and the nation, the general secretary said, adding his revolutionary feats would shine for all ages.

articles.title: Nepali Paper Praises
articles.content:
Nepali Paper Praises 
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- Nepali newspaper Arpan on Jan 27 carried an article titled "Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un, Most Faithful Comrade-in-Arms of General Secretary Kim Jong Il".
					 Looking with pride back on the century of Juche Korea woven with victory and glory under the guidance of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, the Korean army and people launched a dynamic grand advance with the iron will to glorify a new centenary as the annals of prosperity and shining victory under the guidance of supreme leader Kim Jong Un, the newspaper said.
					
					 Kim Jong Un, regarding it as his lifelong mission to creditably carry to completion the revolutionary cause of Juche through generations, has always stood in the van of the revolution and construction together with Kim Jong Il, as his closest and most faithful comrade-in-arms, it stressed.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Commemorated in American Region
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Commemorated in American Region
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- An American regional joint meeting was held in Lima, Peru on Jan. 26 to commemorate the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Present there were personages of the American Regional Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung, the Latin American and Caribbean Regional Committee to Support the Reunification of Korea and political parties and organizations of Peru and popular masses.
					
					 Genaro Ledesma Izquieta, chairman of the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru who is co-chairman of the preparatory committee, and others spoke at the meeting.
					
					 They expressed deep condolences over the demise of Kim Jong Il, saying that he performed enormous feats for the building of a thriving socialist country and national reunification and global independence and passed away while continuing his journey of field guidance in field jacket to their deep regret.
					
					 He will always live in the hearts of mankind, they stressed.
					
					 An appeal, adopted at the meeting, said that national and regional preparatory committees for commemorating the centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung would sponsor to form the preparatory committees for commemorating the 70th birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il and set the commemorative period and organize various political and cultural events with unprecedented splendor.
					
					 It also called for creating and disseminating books and literary and art works in praise of the great persons of Mt. Paektu and widely introducing their greatness through newspapers, radios and Internet homepages.
					
					 It stressed that they would intensify colorful activities to glorify the Day of the Sun in 2012 as the grand political festival common to mankind as noted in the decision, adopted at the consultative meeting of leading officials of the International Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Russian Paper on Case of U.S. Armed Spy Ship Captured by KPA 44 Years Ago
articles.content:
Russian Paper on Case of U.S. Armed Spy Ship Captured by KPA 44 Years Ago
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- The Russian paper Patriot carried in its fourth issue an article 44 years after the U.S. imperialist armed spy ship Pueblo was captured by the Korean People's Army.
					 On Jan. 23, 1968 the KPA Navy captured this ship which was committing espionage after intruding into the territorial waters of the DPRK, the article said, and went on:
					
					 The U.S. asserted that Pueblo neither intruded into the DPRK's territorial waters nor violated international laws and, at the same time, demanded that the DPRK send back the captured ship and its crewmen immediately and make an "apology".
					
					 The DPRK opened to the public material evidence including the testimonies of the captain and crewmen of the ship that it intruded into the territorial waters of the DPRK for spying.
					
					 As things did not go just as desired, the U.S. revealed its scheme to ignite a new war while concentrating vast aggression armed forces around the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung solemnly declared that the DPRK does not want a war but is never afraid of it and the Korean people and army would return retaliation for the U.S. "retaliation" and all-out war for all-out war.
					
					 After all, the U.S. admitted and apologized for the espionage acts by Pueblo and presented the DPRK government with a written apology earnestly pleading for leniency to its crewmen.
					
					 This was the first written apology of the U.S. in its history.

articles.title: Birth Anniversary to Be Commemorated in Nepal
articles.content:
Birth Anniversary to Be Commemorated in Nepal
 Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- A Nepali national preparatory committee for commemorating the 70th birth anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il was formed on January 26.
					 C.P. Mainali, general secretary of the C.C., Nepal Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist), was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The preparatory committee decided to hold various political and cultural events including meeting, seminar and film show and widely introduce through media Kim Jong Il's exploits on the occasion of his birth anniversary.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe regalo de Naguib Sawiris
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe regalo de Naguib Sawiris
 Pyongyang, 3 de febrero (ACNC) -- El Maximo Dirigente del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y el pueblo coreano, Kim Jong Un, recibio el regalo que dedicara Naguib Sawiris, director general de la Sociedad Anonima de Medios y Tecnologias de Telecomunicaciones Orascom de Egipto de visita en Corea.
					 El visitante lo entrego el dia 2 a un funcionario coreano.

articles.title: Reporta frio intenso en Pyongyang
articles.content:
Reporta frio intenso en Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, 3 de febrero (ACNC) -- En estos dias, hace el frio mas intenso despues del ano 1977 en esta capital.
					 La temperatura maxima del dia primero y la minima del dia 2 son 12.3 y 18.7 grados bajo cero, es decir, 11.6 y 7 grados mas bajas que el promedio, respectivamente.
					
					 Otras localidades son afectadas tambien por el frio que proseguira hasta la primera quincena de febrero segun opinan los meteorologos.

articles.title: Presidente Kim Il Sung y la "Cancion del rio Amnok"
articles.content:
Presidente Kim Il Sung y la "Cancion del rio Amnok"
 Pyongyang, 3 de febrero (ACNC) -- Hace mas de 80 anos, el Presidente Kim Il Sung cruzo el rio Amnok con el gran proposito de liberar a Corea colonizada por los imperialistas japoneses.
					 Especificamente, a principios de febrero del 14 (1925) de la Era Juche, el tomo el juramento de derrotar al imperialismo japones entonando la "Cancion del rio Amnok" cuya autoria se desconoce todavia.
					
					 La cancion demuestra el sentimiento afligido del pueblo coreano por el fracaso en el Levantamiento Popular del Primero de Marzo contra el coloniaje japones y refleja su aspiracion patriotica a rescatar el pais sin doblegarse ante el imperialismo japones.
					
					 El Presidente recordaba a menudo esa cancion en todo el curso de la ardua revolucion coreana.
					
					 La menciono durante una recepcion ofrecida por los patriotas coreanos con motivo de su retorno triunfal a la patria y en sus memorias "En el Transcurso del Siglo". 
					
					 En septiembre de 1991, cuando visito el Desembarcadero de Phophyong situado en el distrito Kim Hyong Jik de la provincia de Ryanggang, volvio a cantarla evocando el dia en que cruzo el rio Amnok.
					
					 El pueblo coreano prefiere mucho esa cancion que hace recordar la vida de ese Gran Hombre quien libero la patria y la nacion y construyo este pais independiente y prospero cumpliendo el juramento tomado a la tierna edad de 10 anos y pico.

articles.title: Seminario nacional sobre la idea Juche
articles.content:
Seminario nacional sobre la idea Juche
 Pyongyang, 3 de febrero (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 2 en esta capital el seminario nacional sobre la idea Juche.
					 Asistieron a la ocasion el secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kim Ki Nam, el vicepremier Kim Yong Jin, los funcionarios de los ministerios, instituciones centrales, entidades sociales, los de los organismos del partido, el Poder y la economia de la ciudad de Pyongyang, sectores de ciencia, educacion, cultura y arte, salud publica, prensa e informacion, organos de formacion de cuadros del partido y de la rama de la historia revolucionaria.
					
					 En el foro fueron publicadas 6 disertaciones que explican y argumentan las hazanas inmortales del Dirigente Kim Jong Il quien desarrollo y enriquecio la idea Juche, la revolucionaria del Presidente  Kim Il Sung y la materializo en la practica.
					
					 Intervinieron el editor jefe de la Editora del Periodico Rodong Sinmun, Kim Ki Ryong, el presidente de la Academia de Ciencias Sociales, Thae Hyong Chol, el director de la Escuela Superior del Partido Kim Il Sung, Cha Yong Myong, el rector de la Universidad Politica Kim Il Sung, Cha Kyong Il, el rector de la Universidad de Economia Nacional, Jon Kyong Nam y el secretario responsable del Comite del Partido del Trabajo de Corea en la Provincia de Hwanghae del Norte, Pak Thae Dok.
					
					 Los oradores enfatizaron que el Dirigente    Kim Jong Il es el mas destacado ideologo y teorico de la epoca actual quien al sistematizar la idea Juche, aclaro nitidamente la posicion historica de esta doctrina como unica guia directriz de la epoca de independencia.
					
					 Se refirieron a que el Dirigente respondio perfectamente a los temas teorico-practicos que presentan la epoca y la revolucion basandose en los principios de la idea Juche. 
					
					 El Dirigente aclaro que la independencia es la vida del hombre, o sea, de las masas populares, gracias a lo cual se han definido claramente que el proceso de forja de destino del ser humano es, en esencia, el de realizar la independencia, la meta principal y la direccion de su lucha.
					
					 La idea Juche es la base ideo-teorica que posibilita fortalecer el Partido del Trabajo de Corea como organizacion revolucionaria que ha mantenido siempre la unicidad de la idea y la direccion y como Partido-Madre verdadero que cuida con responsabilidad el destino del pueblo.
					
					 La idea Juche es la bandera invencible que garantiza con firmeza la victoria del socialismo con el poderio de las fuerzas armadas.
					
					 La teoria del Partido del Trabajo de Corea en materia de la construccion del Estado prospero socialista encarna plenamente la demanda de la idea Juche que presenta como principios fundamentales mantener en el maximo nivel la idea de Iminwichon (considerar al pueblo como el cielo) y la independencia de las masas populares.
					
					 Los oradores subrayaron que la gran fuerza espiritual de la nacion de Kim Il Sung basada en la idea Juche, es la poderosa arma para la construccion de un Estado prospero.
